\subsection{extractLocalDataFromDir}
\label{\detokenize{api/MARIGOLD.extractLocalDataFromDir:extractlocaldatafromdir}}\label{\detokenize{api/MARIGOLD.extractLocalDataFromDir::doc}}\index{extractLocalDataFromDir() (in module MARIGOLD)@\spxentry{extractLocalDataFromDir()}\spxextra{in module MARIGOLD}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api/MARIGOLD.extractLocalDataFromDir:MARIGOLD.extractLocalDataFromDir}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{MARIGOLD.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{extractLocalDataFromDir}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{path}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{str}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{dump\_file}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{\textquotesingle{}database.dat\textquotesingle{}}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{in\_dir}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{{[}{]}}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{require\_terms}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{{[}\textquotesingle{}jf\textquotesingle{}{]}}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{skip\_terms}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{{[}\textquotesingle{}CFD\textquotesingle{}, \textquotesingle{}Copy\textquotesingle{}{]}}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{sheet\_type}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{\textquotesingle{}adix\_template\textquotesingle{}}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{append\_to\_json}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{pitot\_sheet}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{False}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{o}{**}\DUrole{n}{kwargs}}}{{ $\rightarrow$ None}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Function for getting all local data from spreadsheets in a directory, path

\sphinxAtStartPar
Does not recursively descend, only checks in the path given

\sphinxAtStartPar
Still under construction, but should support sheet types
‘adix\_template4’
‘ryan\_template’
‘adix\_template’ (maybe rename this quan\_template)

\sphinxAtStartPar
Also can try to infer the sheet type, xlsm will be adix\_template4, if it has P5, 6, or 7 it will
be classified as an adix\_template, different angles ryan, etc. The inference can also be made by
appending \_adix or \_quan or \_ryan to the excel sheets being processed

\sphinxAtStartPar
Custom sheet types may be supported, but they still have to generally follow the classic template
structure. The setup information has to be in sheet ‘1’ and all the local data in sheet ‘2’. Ranges
must be specified as a list of lists

\sphinxAtStartPar
Q1\_ranges = {[}{[}angle1, {[}index1, index2.,..{]}{]}, {[}angle2, {[}index1, index2.,..{]}{]}, …{]}

\sphinxAtStartPar
with the starts and ends

\sphinxAtStartPar
{[}Q1\_start, Q1\_end, Q2\_start, …{]}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Add on pitot starts/ends if pitot\_sheet = True

\sphinxAtStartPar
Need to specify Q1\_check, Q2\_check, etc. as well

\end{fulllineitems}

\subsection{Condition}
\label{\detokenize{api/MARIGOLD.Condition:condition}}\label{\detokenize{api/MARIGOLD.Condition::doc}}\index{Condition (class in MARIGOLD)@\spxentry{Condition}\spxextra{class in MARIGOLD}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api/MARIGOLD.Condition:MARIGOLD.Condition}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class\DUrole{w}{ }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{MARIGOLD.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{Condition}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{jgref}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{float}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{jgloc}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{float}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{jf}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{float}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{theta}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{int}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{port}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{str}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{database}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{str}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{object}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Class to handle the local probe data

\sphinxAtStartPar
Data is stored in the Condition.phi property. It’s actually 3 layers of dictionary
phi {[}angle{]} gives a dictionary with the various r/R
phi {[}angle{]}{[}r/R{]} gives a dictionary with the MIDAS output
The MIDAS output is itself a dictionary, with the keys listed in the “tab\_keys” array
So phi{[}angle{]}{[}r/R{]}{[}‘alpha’{]} should give you the void fraction at r/R for phi = angle
This structure is initialized with zeros for the MIDAS output at the pipe center and wall
\subsubsection*{Attributes Summary}

\index{\_\_call\_\_() (MARIGOLD.Condition method)@\spxentry{\_\_call\_\_()}\spxextra{MARIGOLD.Condition method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api/MARIGOLD.Condition:MARIGOLD.Condition.__call__}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{\_\_call\_\_}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{phi\_in}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{ndarray}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{r\_in}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{ndarray}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{param}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{str}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{interp\_method}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{\textquotesingle{}None\textquotesingle{}}}}{{ $\rightarrow$ ndarray}}
\pysigstopsignatures\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Returns the value of param at (phi, r). Can get raw data, linear interp, or spline interp}
\sphinxAtStartPar
phi in radians

\sphinxAtStartPar
Can also return the value at (x, y) if linear\_xy is selected as the interp method. phi \sphinxhyphen{}\textgreater{} x, r \sphinxhyphen{}\textgreater{} y

\end{description}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{approx\_vf() (MARIGOLD.Condition method)@\spxentry{approx\_vf()}\spxextra{MARIGOLD.Condition method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api/MARIGOLD.Condition:MARIGOLD.Condition.approx_vf}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{approx\_vf}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{n}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{7}}}{{ $\rightarrow$ None}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Method for approximating vf with power\sphinxhyphen{}law relation.

\sphinxAtStartPar
vf\_approx = (n+1)*(2*n+1) / (2*n*n) * (jf / (1\sphinxhyphen{}self.area\_avg(‘alpha’))) * (1 \sphinxhyphen{} abs(rstar))**(1/n)

\sphinxAtStartPar
Will not overwrite vf data if it already exists, but will always store data in
midas\_dict{[}‘vf\_approx’{]} even if midas\_dict{[}‘vf’{]} has data

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{approx\_vf\_Kong() (MARIGOLD.Condition method)@\spxentry{approx\_vf\_Kong()}\spxextra{MARIGOLD.Condition method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}

\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Method for approximating vf from Kong. TODO

\sphinxAtStartPar

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{area\_avg() (MARIGOLD.Condition method)@\spxentry{area\_avg()}\spxextra{MARIGOLD.Condition method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api/MARIGOLD.Condition:MARIGOLD.Condition.area_avg}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{area\_avg}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{param}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{str}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{even\_opt}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{\textquotesingle{}first\textquotesingle{}}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{recalc}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{True}}}{{ $\rightarrow$ float}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Method for calculating the area\sphinxhyphen{}average of a parameter, “param”

\sphinxAtStartPar
param can be anything MIDAS outputs, but usually of interest are “alpha” or “alpha\_ug”
If you’re not sure what somethings named, try Condition.phi{[}90{]}{[}1.0{]}.keys()

\sphinxAtStartPar
Uses Simpson’s rule for integration, even\_opt passed to that. Will save the previously calculated area averages
in Condition.area\_avgs{[}param{]}, and won’t recalculate unless recalc = True

\sphinxAtStartPar
Returns the area\sphinxhyphen{}averaged parameter, or None if the method failed

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{calc\_W() (MARIGOLD.Condition method)@\spxentry{calc\_W()}\spxextra{MARIGOLD.Condition method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}

\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar

\index{calc\_avg\_lat\_sep() (MARIGOLD.Condition method)@\spxentry{calc\_avg\_lat\_sep()}\spxextra{MARIGOLD.Condition method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api/MARIGOLD.Condition:MARIGOLD.Condition.calc_avg_lat_sep}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{calc\_avg\_lat\_sep}}}{}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Calculates average lateral separation distance between bubbles

\sphinxAtStartPar
Average lateral separation, λ given by
λ = ugl / f

\sphinxAtStartPar
stores in midas dict under lambda. Also estimates α based on λ,

\sphinxAtStartPar
α \textasciitilde{} Db / λ

\sphinxAtStartPar
Mirrors the data

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{calc\_cd() (MARIGOLD.Condition method)@\spxentry{calc\_cd()}\spxextra{MARIGOLD.Condition method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api/MARIGOLD.Condition:MARIGOLD.Condition.calc_cd}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{calc\_cd}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{method}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{\textquotesingle{}Ishii\sphinxhyphen{}Zuber\textquotesingle{}}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{rho\_f}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{998}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{vr\_cheat}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{False}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{mu\_f}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{0.001}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Method for calculating drag coefficient

\sphinxAtStartPar
If vr = 0, assume cd = 0

\sphinxAtStartPar
Options are Ishii\sphinxhyphen{}Zuber and Schiller\sphinxhyphen{}Naumann, but both use
Reb = (1 \sphinxhyphen{} midas\_dict{[}‘alpha’{]}) * midas\_dict{[}‘Dsm1’{]} * rho\_f * midas\_dict{[}‘vr’{]} / midas\_dict{[}‘mu\_m’{]}
vr from calc\_vr()
mu\_m from calc\_mu\_eff()

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{calc\_dpdz() (MARIGOLD.Condition method)@\spxentry{calc\_dpdz()}\spxextra{MARIGOLD.Condition method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api/MARIGOLD.Condition:MARIGOLD.Condition.calc_dpdz}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{calc\_dpdz}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{method}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{\textquotesingle{}LM\textquotesingle{}}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{rho\_f}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{998}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{rho\_g}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{1.225}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{mu\_f}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{0.001}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{mu\_g}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{1.18e\sphinxhyphen{}05}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{LM\_C}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{25}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Calculates the pressure gradient, dp/dz, according to various methods. Can access later with self.dpdz

\sphinxAtStartPar
‘LM’ \sphinxhyphen{}\textgreater{} Lockhart Martinelli, assuming turbulent\sphinxhyphen{}turbulent, C = LM\_C

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{calc\_errors() (MARIGOLD.Condition method)@\spxentry{calc\_errors()}\spxextra{MARIGOLD.Condition method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api/MARIGOLD.Condition:MARIGOLD.Condition.calc_errors}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{calc\_errors}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{param1}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{str}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{param2}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{str}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Calculates the errors, ε, between two parameters (param1 \sphinxhyphen{} param2) in midas\_dict
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Stores:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
error, “eps\_param1\_param2”, param1 \sphinxhyphen{} param2

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
relative, “eps\_rel\_param1\_param2”, (param1 \sphinxhyphen{} param2) / param2

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
absolute relative, “eps\_abs\_rel\_param1\_param2”, {\color{red}\bfseries{}|param1 \sphinxhyphen{} param2|} / param2

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
square, “eps\_sq\_param1\_param2”, (param1 \sphinxhyphen{} param2)**2

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
relative square, “eps\_rel\_sq\_param1\_param2”, ((param1 \sphinxhyphen{} param2)/param2)**2

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
If param2 = 0, relative errors are considered 0

\end{description}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{calc\_grad() (MARIGOLD.Condition method)@\spxentry{calc\_grad()}\spxextra{MARIGOLD.Condition method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api/MARIGOLD.Condition:MARIGOLD.Condition.calc_grad}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{calc\_grad}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{param}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{str}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{recalc}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{False}}}{{ $\rightarrow$ None}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Calculates gradient of param based on the data in self.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Stored in self’s midas\_dict as grad\_param\_r, grad\_param\_phi, etc.
Will only be called once, unless recalc is True.

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{calc\_linear\_interp() (MARIGOLD.Condition method)@\spxentry{calc\_linear\_interp()}\spxextra{MARIGOLD.Condition method}}

\index{calc\_vgj() (MARIGOLD.Condition method)@\spxentry{calc\_vgj()}\spxextra{MARIGOLD.Condition method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api/MARIGOLD.Condition:MARIGOLD.Condition.calc_vgj}}

\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Method for calculating Vgj, by doing

\sphinxAtStartPar
j\_local = midas\_dict{[}‘alpha’{]} * midas\_dict{[}‘ug1’{]} + (1 \sphinxhyphen{} midas\_dict{[}‘alpha’{]}) * midas\_dict{[}‘vf’{]}
vgj = midas\_dict{[}‘ug1’{]} \sphinxhyphen{} j\_local

\sphinxAtStartPar
stored in midas\_dict{[}‘vgj’{]}

\sphinxAtStartPar
warn\_approx is a flag to print out a warning statement if vf is being approximated, which will
happen if not found

\end{fulllineitems}

\sphinxhyphen{} “wake\_1” vr = \sphinxhyphen{} c3 * vf * Cd**(1./3)

\index{mirror() (MARIGOLD.Condition method)@\spxentry{mirror()}\spxextra{MARIGOLD.Condition method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api/MARIGOLD.Condition:MARIGOLD.Condition.mirror}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{mirror}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{sym90}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{True}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{axisym}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{False}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{uniform\_rmesh}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{False}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{force\_remirror}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{False}}}{{ $\rightarrow$ None}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Mirrors data, so we have data for every angle

\sphinxAtStartPar
First finds all the angles with data, copies anything negative to the
other side (deleting the negative entries in the original). Then goes
though each of the angles in \_angles (22.5° increments) and makes sure
each has data. Either copying, assuming some kind of symmetry (either
axisym or sym90) or just filling in zeros.

\sphinxAtStartPar
uniform\_rmesh will ensure every angle has data for every r/R point. Will
linearly interpolate when data on either side is available

\sphinxAtStartPar
Force\_remirror is untested, no clue if it’s safe or not

\sphinxAtStartPar
Also saves the original mesh (r, φ) pairs under self.original\_mesh

\sphinxAtStartPar
Quadrant definitions:
\begin{quote}
\begin{quote}
\begin{quote}
\begin{quote}
\begin{quote}
\begin{quote}
\begin{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
phi =  90
\end{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
, \sphinxhyphen{} \textasciitilde{} \textasciitilde{} \textasciitilde{} \sphinxhyphen{} ,
\end{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
, ‘       |        ‘ ,
\end{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
,           |            ,
\end{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
,     II     |    I        ,
\end{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
,             |             ,
\end{quote}
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{180 ,————\sphinxhyphen{}{\color{red}\bfseries{}|}————\sphinxhyphen{}, 0}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{,             |             ,}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{,    III     |   IV       ,}\begin{description}

\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{label\_str}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{rot\_angle}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{0}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{ngridr}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{50}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{ngridphi}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{50}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{colormap}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{\textquotesingle{}hot\_r\textquotesingle{}}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{num\_levels}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{100}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{title}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{False}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{title\_str}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{\textquotesingle{}\textquotesingle{}}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{extra\_text}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{\textquotesingle{}\textquotesingle{}}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{annotate\_h}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{False}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{cartesian}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{False}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{h\_star\_kwargs}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{\{\textquotesingle{}method\textquotesingle{}: \textquotesingle{}max\_dsm\textquotesingle{}, \textquotesingle{}min\_void\textquotesingle{}: \textquotesingle{}0.05\textquotesingle{}\}}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{plot\_measured\_points}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{False}}}{{ $\rightarrow$ None}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Method to plot contour of a given param

\sphinxAtStartPar
Generates a contour plot of any parameter in midas\_dict, e.g. ‘alpha’, ‘ai’, etc. By default, just shows the figure,
but if a save\_dir is specified, it will save it there instead. label\_str can adjust the label of the colorbar. Can accept Latex format, e.g.
r”\$lpha\$ {[}\sphinxhyphen{}{]}”

\sphinxAtStartPar
set\_max and set\_min set the bounds of the contour plot, and the colormap option allows for any colors that matplotlib supports. ngridr, ngridphi,
num\_levels, all adjust how fine the contour plot is generated.

\sphinxAtStartPar
annotate\_h is an option to draw a horizontal line at some given position. This was implemented when investigating where the bubble layer typically
stops. h\_star\_kwargs and cartesian are optinos related to this.

\sphinxAtStartPar
plot\_measured points is neat, it plots circles where original data was detected (determined prior to mirroring)

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{rough\_FR\_ID() (MARIGOLD.Condition method)@\spxentry{rough\_FR\_ID()}\spxextra{MARIGOLD.Condition method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api/MARIGOLD.Condition:MARIGOLD.Condition.rough_FR_ID}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{rough\_FR\_ID}}}{}{{ $\rightarrow$ None}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Identifies the flow regime for the given condition, by some rough methods

\sphinxAtStartPar
First checks if it matches any given by previous researchers, or the hierarchical
clustering algorithm results

\sphinxAtStartPar
Stored in self.FR

\sphinxAtStartPar
1 = bubbly
2 = plug
3 = slug
4 = churn
5 = stratified
6 = stratified wavy
7 = annular

\end{fulllineitems}
